tha-ap151:0.3_0: Hearing his speech, the most senior monk, the junior ones, and awelcoming.
tha-ap151:1.2_0: aspiring to the level of the bad.
tha-ap151:1.4_0: plunged deep into the Great Wood.
tha-ap151:2.3_0: I bowed down to the Buddha,
tha-ap151:2.4_0: for the whole world of the world.
tha-ap151:3.1_0: I died at thirty years of age,
tha-ap151:3.3_0: I’m not aware of any bad places
tha-ap151:4.1_0: T less than twenty years old
tha-ap151:5.1_0: Attaining the four kinds of textual analysis
tha-ap151:6.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Vakkali.
tha-ap151:7.1_0: The ninth part of the senior Vaṭācārā, who loved by the senior monks.
